From the office of the Bishop of Huron:

"The Provincial Government has announced today that the provincial stay-at-home order has been extended a further two weeks until May 15, 2021.  In order to give parishes time for planning and discussion, the Bishop of Huron directs that all parishes in the Diocese of Huron remain closed to in-person worship until at least June 1, 2021. A decision will be made by the bishop in mid-May as to whether or not parishes may plan to hold in-person worship after June 1st.

Also announced today was a change to the numbers permitted at outdoor religious services, weddings or funerals.  A maximum of 10 people, including clergy and others involved in the service (but not including funeral home staff) will be permitted."

Please continue to reach out and connect with one another - love grows when we plant and nurture the seeds!
